ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you currently receive outpatient mental health treatment?
Have you received any mental health treatment?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2 = Not Sure; 888 = non applicable

ElementDescription: At what age did you first receive mental health care?
Do you see a therapist/counselor?
Do you see a psychiatrist/someone about medication?
Do you participate in any group therapy?
How about family therapy?
Do you receive any other type of professional support for emotions?
How old were you the first time you were in any type of outpatient treatment?
Has the subject ever been hospitalized for psychiatric reasons including substance use (lifetime)?
How many times have you (or subject if informant) been hospitalized for psychiatric reasons? (Best estimate)
How old were you (or what year was) the first time you were hospitalized for psychiatric symptoms
Do you currently take any medication for mental health issues
Name first medication that the participant has taken
First medication dosage
Name second medication that the participant has taken
Second medication dosage
Name third medication that the participant has taken
Third medication dosage
Name fourth medication that the participant has taken
Fourth  medication dosage
Name fifth medication that the participant has taken
Fifth medication dosage
In the past month, have you regularly taken: Sleep aids: Benzodiazepines?
How many days per week did you use Sleep aids: Benzodiazepines?
Notes: 1= Less than one day per week; 2= 1 day; 3= 2-3 days; 4= 4 to 5 days; 5= 6+ days

ElementDescription: How many tablets per week of Sleep aids: Benzodiazepines did you take?
Notes: 1=1 to 2 tablets; 2=3 to 5 tablets; 3=6 to 14 tablets; 4=15+ tablets

ElementDescription: In the past month, have you taken: Sleep aids: Zolpidem?
How many days per week did you use Sleep aids: Zolpidem?
Notes: 1= Less than one day per week; 2= 1 day; 3= 2-3 days; 4= 4 to 5 days; 5= 6+ days

ElementDescription: How many tablets per week of Sleep aids: Zolpidem did you take?
Notes: 1=1 to 2 tablets; 2=3 to 5 tablets; 3=6 to 14 tablets; 4=15+ tablets

ElementDescription: In the past month, have you taken: Other Sleep aids?
How many days per week did you use Other Sleep aids?
Notes: 1= Less than one day per week; 2= 1 day; 3= 2-3 days; 4= 4 to 5 days; 5= 6+ days

ElementDescription: How many tablets per week of Other Sleep aids did you take?
Notes: 1=1 to 2 tablets; 2=3 to 5 tablets; 3=6 to 14 tablets; 4=15+ tablets

ElementDescription: In the past month, have you taken: Over-the-counter sleep medications?
How many days per week did you use Over-the-counter sleep medications?
Notes: 1= Less than one day per week; 2= 1 day; 3= 2-3 days; 4= 4 to 5 days; 5= 6+ days

ElementDescription: How many tablets per week of Over-the-counter sleep medications did you take?
Notes: 1=1 to 2 tablets; 2=3 to 5 tablets; 3=6 to 14 tablets; 4=15+ tablets

ElementDescription: In the past month, have you taken: Minor tranquilizers?
How many days per week did you use Minor tranquilizers?
Notes: 1= Less than one day per week; 2= 1 day; 3= 2-3 days; 4= 4 to 5 days; 5= 6+ days

ElementDescription: How many tablets per week of Minor tranquilizers?
Notes: 1=1 to 2 tablets; 2=3 to 5 tablets; 3=6 to 14 tablets; 4=15+ tablets

ElementDescription: Have you EVER used opiate pain relievers either with or without a prescription?
How old were you THE FIRST TIME you used opiate pain relievers?
In the past 12 months, have you used opiate pain relievers?
In the past 12 months, have you used opiate pain relievers? How often IN THE PAST 12 MONTHS?
Notes: 1= Once a month or less; 2= 2 to 3 times a month; 3= 1 to 2 times a week; 4= 3 to 5 times a week; 5= 6 or more times a week

ElementDescription: In the past month, have you used, opiate pain relievers?
Have you EVER been in treatment for any event that you have indicated?
Have you EVER used marijuana?

Notes: 1= Once a month or less; 2= 2 to 3 times a month; 3= 1 to 2 times a week; 4= 3 to 5 times a week; 5= 6 or more times a week

ElementDescription: Have you used marijuana for any of the following reasons?

How many times has this happened to you?
How old were you THE FIRST TIME this happened?
How old were you THE MOST RECENT TIME this happened?

Did you EVER get a prescription for medicine for the reactions just described from any type of professional?

In general, how satisfied are you with the treatment(s) you received?
Notes: 1= Very satisfied; 2= Satisfied; 3= Neither satisfied or dissatisfied; 4= Dissatisfied; 5= Very dissatisfied

ElementDescription: Did the treatment(s) help alleviate your symptoms?
Notes: 1= A lot; 2= Some; 3= A little; 4= Not at all

ElementDescription: Are you still receiving treatment?
